[shameless plug by an Agitar employee]

You can see an actual dashboard here (the other link was to a screenshot)

http://www.agitar.com/openquality/openquality.shtml


Most of the dashboards listed here report on junit test results only. 
The reports for our own products (Agitator and Dashboard) include a 
mixture of junit and agitation results.

Kevin

Robert Watkins wrote:
> Cedric Beust wrote:
> 
>>>I understand that Agitar's tool can do something like this, 
>>>which may be a starting point if you've got more money than 
>>>time (I don't know the price of Agitator, but I understand 
>>>it's not cheap).
>>
>>
>>Actually, I believe that what Agitar does is different from what Bradley is
>>asking.  If I understood correctly, Agitar monitors test runs, analyzes what
>>values are passed to your tests and then creates more tests with
>>combinations of these values.
> 
> 
> Well, yes, that's what Agitar's Agitator does. Agitar also has a 'Agitator 
> Management Dashboard' (http://www.agitar.com/products/000023.html) which 
> does the trendh analysis (amongst other things). I should have been clearer 
> about what I meant.
> 
> Robert.
